thread.title: Angus Bruneau, businessman and philanthropist, dead at 81
thread.title_full: Angus Bruneau, businessman and philanthropist, dead at 81

author: cbc
title: Angus Bruneau, businessman and philanthropist, dead at 81
text:
Prominent Newfoundland businessman, educator, and philanthropist Angus Bruneau has died.
MUN's music school receives substantial donation Fortis founder, wife make $1M donation to MUN Bruneau was the founding dean of the Faculty of Engineering and Applied Science at Memorial University in 1968, founded Fortis Inc. in 1987 and was a well known philanthropist in the city of St. John's.
We are deeply saddened by the passing of our founder Dr. Angus Bruneau. A visionary business leader w/ incredible passion for educ & giving.
â€” @Fortis_NA Over the years, Bruneau and his wife Jean have donated millions to Memorial University, and in a statement MUN Dean of Engineering Greg Naterer extended his condolences to the family.
"Words alone cannot express how much of an immense contribution Dr. Bruneau has made to our faculty, university and province and how his giant presence will be missed."
Visitation for Bruneau will be held on Feb. 21 and 22 at Carnell's Funeral Home in St. John's.
The funeral will be held on Feb. 23 at St. David's Presbyterian Church.
